name: Eighty-Four Suspects
description:
There are eighty-four suspects in this sleepy town, and one of them is a killer on the loose. You're the detective assigned to the case, and it's your job to find the killer and bring them to justice.

The townsfolk's appearances are randomly generated each time you play, giving endless replay-ability. To find the killer, you must complete errands for the few townsfolk who know their identity,  then you'll be able to ask them a question about the killer's appearance to narrow down the potential suspects until you have to finally make your accusation. But we aware, you only have three guesses at finding the killer before it's game over. 

This game was made with the intention of entering MizJam1, but I missed the deadline so instead decided to take another week or so to flesh it out to the full idea I wanted.

The game is as finished as it will get as it was just a jam game, but if there are a notable amount of bugs that get brought up I will update the game with fixes.

Please let me know how you get on with the game, good or bad I'd love to hear feedback.
